ai-sn18:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn18:1.1.3_0: Then Venerable Rāhula went to the Buddha,
ai-sn18:1.1.3_2: Seated to one side, Rāhula said to the Buddha:
ai-sn18:1.1.4_0: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
ai-sn18:1.2.2_0: Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:1.2.4_0: “But if they’re impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn18:1.2.6_0: “But if they’re impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn18:1.2.7_0: does someone regard things like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn18:1.3.5_0: “Is the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ... mind ...
ai-sn18:1.3.7_0: “What do you think: are impermanence or not?”—
ai-sn18:1.3.9_0: Is the mind permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:1.3.11_0: “But if they’re impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn18:1.3.13_0: “But if they’re impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn18:1.3.14_0: does someone regard things like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn18:1.4.1_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye ... ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn18:1.4.1_1: They are repelled by the ear, repelled by sounds, repelled by ear-consciousness, repelled by ear-contact, repelled by whatever feelings arise because of ear-contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful.
ai-sn18:1.4.1_2: They are disillusioned with the nose ...
ai-sn18:1.4.1_3: They are repelled by the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn18:1.4.1_4: They are disillusioned with the body,
ai-sn18:1.4.1_5: They are repelled by the mind, repelled by mental phenomena,
ai-sn18:1.4.2_0: Being repelled, they become desireless. Because they are desireless, they are freed. When they are freed, they know they are freed.
ai-sn18:1.4.3_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn18:1.4.4_0: (Each set of ten discourses should be treated in the same way.)
ai-sn18:1.4.5_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn18:2.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with sights ...
ai-sn18:3.1.9_0: Is mind consciousness permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:3.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with eye consciousness ...
ai-sn18:3.1.11_1: They grow disillusioned with the ear consciousness ...
ai-sn18:3.1.11_3: They are repelled by tongue consciousness,
ai-sn18:3.1.11_4: Both is repelled by the body, repelled by consciousness, repelled by mental phenomena, repelled by body-consciousness,
ai-sn18:4.1.9_0: Is mind contact permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:4.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with eye contact.
ai-sn18:4.1.11_3: They grow disillusioned with tongue contact,
ai-sn18:5.1.3_0: Is feeling born of eye contact permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:5.1.9_0: Is feeling born of mind contact permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:5.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with feeling born of eye contact, ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact. ...”
ai-sn18:6.1.3_0: Is perception of sights permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:6.1.9_0: Is perception of thoughts permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:6.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the perception of sights ...
ai-sn18:7.1.3_0: Is intention regarding sights permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:7.1.9_0: Is intention regarding thoughts permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:7.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with intention regarding sights ...
ai-sn18:8.1.3_0: Is craving for sights permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:8.1.9_0: Is craving for thoughts permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:8.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with craving for sights ...
ai-sn18:8.1.11_5: craving for thoughts, and they are repelled by craving.
ai-sn18:9.1.3_0: Is the earth element permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:9.1.9_0: Is the consciousness element permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:9.1.11_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the earth element ...
ai-sn18:9.1.11_1: They are repelled by the water element, repelled by the water element,
ai-sn18:9.1.11_2: They grow disillusioned with the fire element,
ai-sn18:9.1.11_4: the space element, the space element, the space element,
ai-sn18:9.1.11_5: They grow disillusioned with the consciousness element. ...”
ai-sn18:10.1.10_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn18:10.1.10_3: They are repelled by choices, repelled by choices, repelled by intentional activities, and repelled by intentional activities.
ai-sn18:10.1.11_0: Being repelled, they become desireless. Because they are desireless, they are freed. When they are freed, they know they are freed.
ai-sn18:10.1.12_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn18:11.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī.
ai-sn18:11.1.3_0: Then Venerable Rāhula went to the Buddha,
ai-sn18:11.1.5_0: Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:11.1.7_0: “But if they’re impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn18:11.1.9_0: “But if they’re impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn18:11.1.10_0: does someone regard things like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn18:11.1.16_0: Is the mind permanent or impermanent?”
ai-sn18:11.1.18_0: “But if they’re impermanent, are they suffering or happiness?”
ai-sn18:11.1.20_0: “But if they’re impermanent, suffering, and perishable, are they fit to be regarded thus:
ai-sn18:11.1.21_0: does someone regard things like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-sn18:11.1.23_0: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye ... ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn18:11.1.23_1: They are repelled by the ear, repelled by sounds, repelled by ear-consciousness, repelled by ear-contact, repelled by whatever feelings arise because of ear-contact—whether pleasant, painful, or neither-pleasant-nor-painful.
ai-sn18:11.1.23_2: They are disillusioned with the nose ...
ai-sn18:11.1.23_3: They are repelled by the ear ... nose ... tongue ... body ...
ai-sn18:11.1.23_4: They are disillusioned with the body,
ai-sn18:11.1.23_5: They are repelled by the mind, repelled by mental phenomena,
ai-sn18:11.1.24_0: Being repelled, they become desireless. Because they are desireless, they are freed. When they are freed, they know they are freed.
ai-sn18:11.1.25_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn18:11.1.26_0: (Each set of ten discourses should be treated in the same way.)
ai-sn18:11.1.27_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn18:12-20.0.3_0: 12–20. The Nine Discourses on Sights, Etc.
ai-sn18:12-20.4.1_0: Feeling born of eye contact ... ear contact ... nose contact ... tongue contact ... body contact ...
ai-sn18:12-20.9.1_0: They truly understand form ... feeling ... perception ... choices ... consciousness—which is not-self—as suffering.
ai-sn18:12-20.9.8_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn18:21.1.2_0: Then Venerable Rāhula went to the Buddha,
ai-sn18:21.1.2_2: Seated to one side, Rāhula said to the Buddha:
ai-sn18:21.1.3_0: “Sir, how does one know and see so that the mind is not rid of ego, possessiveness, or underlying tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli?”
ai-sn18:21.1.4_0: “Rāhula, you should truly see any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: *all* form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn18:21.1.5_0: When one truly sees any kind of feeling ...
ai-sn18:21.1.6_0: Any kind of perception at all ...
ai-sn18:21.1.7_0: Any kind of choices at all ...
ai-sn18:21.1.8_0: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: *all* consciousness—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-sn18:21.1.9_0: That’s how to know and see so that there’s no ego, possessiveness, or underlying tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli.”
ai-sn18:22.1.2_0: Then Venerable Rāhula went to the Buddha,
ai-sn18:22.1.2_2: Seated to one side, Rāhula said to the Buddha:
ai-sn18:22.1.3_0: “Sir, how does one know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and well freed?”
ai-sn18:22.1.4_0: “Rāhula, when one truly sees any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: *all* form—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self,’ one is freed by not grasping.
ai-sn18:22.2.1_0: When one truly sees any kind of feeling ...
ai-sn18:22.2.2_0: Any kind of perception at all ...
ai-sn18:22.2.3_0: Any kind of choices at all ...
ai-sn18:22.2.4_0: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: *all* consciousness—with right understanding: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ And having seen this with right understanding they’re freed by not grasping.
ai-sn18:22.2.5_0: That’s how to know and see so that the mind is rid of ego, possessiveness, and conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli; and going beyond discrimination, it’s peaceful and well freed.”
ai-sn18:22.3.5_0: Even if he has gone beyond,
ai-sn18:22.3.7_0: The Linked Discourses with Rāhula are complete.
